article.body: President Donald Trump hailed a stronger-than-forecast jobs report on Thursday, saying the U.S. economy is âroaring backâ even as the recovery comes under threat from a renewed surge in coronavirus cases. Addressing reporters at the White House, Trump said the economy was coming back âextremely strong,â after the government reported the return of 4.8 million jobs in June and an unemployment rate falling for the second straight month to 11.1%. Still, the survey was taken before the latest wave of coronavirus cases erupted, and economists are urging caution. The jobs data came as Trump is lagging behind presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden in national polls and surveys of battleground-state voters. Though Biden tops Trump in most polls, the president has led Biden on the question of who would be better for the economy. U.S. stocks opened sharply higher after the June jobs report, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% Â gaining more than 400 points. But the Dow ended the session 92 points higher as investors digested the monthly employment report amid rising numbers of new coronavirus cases in Florida and elsewhere.
